Member Function Documentation

affectedRows (  ) 

Returns the number of affected rows in this query.

If this query did not affect any rows 0 is returned.

Returns:
The number of rows affected by this query.

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

Definition at line 192 of file CMOracleQuery.php.

availableMethods (  ) 

Get available methods.

This method works in the same way availableMethods() for CMDatabaseProtocol works.

 $q = $dbh->query("select * from mytable");
 $features = $q->availableMethods();
 if(!in_array($features, 'fetch'))
   die("We can't read the result!");
Returns:
An array of method names.

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

Definition at line 72 of file CMOracleQuery.php.

fetch ( $  rowMode = 'assoc',
$  formatter = false 
)

Return the next result row from the query as an associative array.

Once all the rows in the result set have been interated false is returned. 

 $q = $dbh->query("select * from mytable");
 while($r = $q->next()) {
  print_r($r);
 }
Parameters:
$rowMode How each row is converted into an array.

'assoc' Associative array. This is the default
'line' Non-associative array.
'pair' First and second column become key-value.
'cell' Only use the first column.
$formatter See Using a formatter on indervidual fetch() calls

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

Parameters:

$direction The fetching direction.
